title.narrative: Emergency Seed Response for Meher dependent vulnerable households

description.narrative:
The 2015 El Niño episode has had a major impact on the agriculture sector performance with two consecutive crop failures and crop production having decreased by between 50 and 90%. The consecutive crop failures mean that in March 2016, over 10.2 million people are suffering from food insecurity in Ethiopia, compared to 2.9 million in February 2015. Projections indicate that the number is likely to rise to around 15 million in 2016. Peak assistance needs are expected between June and September 2016. The two main planting seasons in Ethiopia are the Belg and the Meher the latter being tied to the Kiremt rainy season (June-September). 80% of the population relies on rain fed agriculture, and the Meher season, which is upon us, accounts for more than 80% of the crop production in the country. GOAL, CONCERN, OXFAM, PLAN, and ACF have formed a consortium for the purpose of this project which aims to improve the food security situation of vulnerable households affected by the El-Nino induced drought through the timely distribution of early maturing and improved drought resistant crop seeds for the Meher planting season. The project will target a total of 135,901141,301 households with seeds that have been selected in conjunction with the local authorities and communities. The seeds selected are Teff, Maize, Sorghum, Haricot Beans, Wheat, Barley and chickpeas. The seeds were selected together with the local agriculture offices based on their adaptability to the areas of intervention.
This action will target three Regions namely Amhara, Tigray and Oromia, and 28 Woredas within these regions as follows:
PLAN : Amhara Region: South Gonder Zone, Ebinat Woreda. North Gonder Zone, W.Belesa, Telemt Woreda. North Wollo Zone. Lasta Woreda. Wag Himra Zone, Sahala Woreda.
ACF: Oromia Region: Arsi Zone, Gololcha and Robe Woreda. East Hararghe Zone, Bedeno Woreda. West Hararghe Zone, Tullo, Anchar and Messela Woreda.
CONCERN: Amhara Region: North Gonder Zone, Beyeda, Debark, Wegera and West Belesa Woredas
GOAL: Amhara Region: South Wollo Zone, Legehida, Tenta, Woreilu Woredas. Tigray Region: Eastern Zone, A/Womberta, Ganta Afeshom, Hawzen Woredas. South Eastern Zone, H/Wajirat Woreda. Oromia Region: Arsi Zone, Sude Woreda
OXFAM: Oromia Region: West Arsi Zone, Shala, Shashamane, Siraro, Arsi, Negelle and Adaba Woredas
A total of 4433.242 MT of seeds will be distributed. At this stage it is not possible to divide the seeds by type due to OXFAM's voucher intervention.
All agencies will provide seeds for .50ha per household
All consortium partners with the exception of OXFAM will conduct direct distributions. OXFAM will implement the project through a voucher system, whereby local vendors involved in the voucher system will also be considered beneficiaries
